item.description:
INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED SPANISH WORKSHOP


CUENTO: "TALPA "
AUTHOR: JUAN RULFO


Are you head over heels in love with Hispanic Literature? Do you need to practice and keep developing your Spanish skills? This is an ideal place for you. Reading in Spanish can improve your vocabulary, comprehension and more.

This 2-hour highly interactive Intermediate and advanced Spanish workshop will help you:


  • Understand the idioms used in the story
  • Increase your comprehension of Latin American culture
  • Discuss about styles and topics of Latin American Literature
  • Improve your accent and intonation
  • Analyze the grammar used in the story



Requirements to sign up for this workshop include:

• Reading the story selected ahead of time
• Having been placed at the intermediate or advanced level at high school, college and/or a language school


We will use the book "Contemporary latin American Literature. Original Selections from the Literary Giants for Intermediate and Advanced Students" by Gladys M. Varona-Lacey. Ed Mc Graw Hill. If you want to you can get it here. I recommend this edition because it has Biographical notes introduce each author and provide readers with English definitions of difficult Spanish words and some explanations of historical events. (Or you can find the story on the web)

Each time we meet we'll pick a short story to read from the book mentioned lines above. We'll have a lively discussion, exchange ideas and gain some cultural insights.


This Intermediate/ Advanced Spanish Workshop will be conducted by Guilianna, Assistant Organizer of this Meetup group and Spanish tutor at Spanish Black Belt, leading Spanish language school servicing in Boston.



This workshop is not free. Cost per person for this 2-hour-long workshop is $19 ($9 for the first one signing up).- Only 6 persons are allowed per workshop so please sign up on-line through our secure Meetup page quickly enough to secure a seat. Payment will not be accepted at the door. Refunds can be granted ONLY if requested 5 days prior to the workshop's assigned date.





If you cannot make it to this workshop, or would prefer to attend a more regular class, please click here to access all Small Group sessions currently being offered by Spanish Black Belt.
